data.title: LGBTQ 10-Minute Plays from Around the World
data.meta_description: Explore hundreds of free public events throughout the academic year related to Italian culture, produced and hosted by Casa Italiana Zerilli-Marimò at NYU.
data.text:
Rainbow Jubilee is a series of three events that Casa Italiana put together with its theater company in residence KIT to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Stonewall uprising. The events will feature LGBTQ theater respectively from Italy (February 25th), the US (March 25th) and from the rest of the world (April 15th): three events of live performance to discover how much LGBTQ topics have been portrayed on stage and by what means.

This event will feature a reading of thirteen 10-minute plays from Turkey, Italy, and the US, selected by an international jury. The audience and a committee will vote the best three that will receive a staged presentation during the In Scena! Theater Festival opening night at Casa Italiana on April 29.

Program:

A Mother’s Privilege by Donna Hoke (US)

Adios by Richard Ballon (US)

Blue Parachute by Yilong Liu (US)

We Make Due by Raine Grayson (US)

I Do, Do You by Leland Frenkel (US)

Sleeping with the Fish by Joe Gulla (US)

Threesome by Jack Hannon (US)

Callus by Ayse Alagoz (Turkey)

Innocent Zone by Erenay Isik (Turkey)

Pembe Tezkere by Ayse Alagoz (Turkey)

10 Minutes by Apo Kaya (Turkey)

Orlando by Federica Cucco (Italy)

Tqila by Chiara Boscaro and Marco Di Stefano (Italy)

This event is made possible in part with public funds from Creative Engagement, supported by the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council and administered by LMCC.
